intro: Erlangea trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaf erlangea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Erlangea trifoliata is often found in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded environments.
